meanings.def: a series of musical notes that are sung or played in a particular order to form a piece of music
examples: to sing/whistle a tune
He was humming a familiar tune.
I can play a few tunes on the piano.
I don't know the title but I recognize the tune.
It was a catchy tune (= easy to remember).
to the tune of something a football song sung to the tune of (= using the tune of) ‘When the saints go marching in’
a show/dance/pop tune
The kids were picking out a popular tune on the old piano.
a collection of classic tunes
an old jazz tune
He wasn't allowed in the choir because he couldn't hold a tune (= sing the correct notes).

meanings.def: to be/not be singing or playing the correct musical notes to sound pleasant
examples: None of them could sing in tune.
The piano is out of tune.

meanings.def: to be/not be in agreement with somebody/something; to have/not have the same opinions, feelings, interests, etc. as somebody/something
examples: These proposals are perfectly in tune with our own thoughts on the subject.
The President is out of tune with public opinion.

meanings.def: to be the person who controls a situation
to express a different opinion or behave in a different way when your situation changes
examples: Wait until it happens to him—he'll soon change his tune.

meanings.def: to do whatever somebody tells you to
the person who provides the money for something can also control how it is spent
to behave in a different way from other people; to have different attitudes or ideas
examples: She was a gifted and original artist who marched to a different drummer.

meanings.def: to change your opinion about somebody/something or your attitude towards somebody/something
used to emphasize how much money something has cost
examples: The hotel has been refurbished to the tune of a million dollars.

meanings.def: to make changes to a musical instrument so that it plays at the correct pitch
examples: to tune a guitar

meanings.def: to make changes to an engine so that it runs smoothly and as well as possible
examples: a finely tuned engine

meanings.def: to change the controls on a radio or television so that you can receive a particular programme or channel
examples: be tuned (in) (to something) The radio was tuned (in) to the BBC World Service.
(informal) Stay tuned for the news coming up next.
He heard everything through a screen of interference, like on a badly tuned radio.
Most phones will automatically tune to the strongest network signal.

meanings.def: to prepare or change something so that it is suitable for a particular situation
examples: His speech was tuned to what the audience wanted to hear.
